fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-4730].
  {panel}


h3. Problem Definition
Currently, Confluence allows the import/export of Microsoft Word document, but not the OpenDocument (.odt).
h3. Suggested Solution
Allow OpenDocument documents to be imported (converted to Wiki markup) and confluence pages to be exported as OpenDocument.

h3. Workaround 
There's no workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: OpenDocument Import/Export

fields.description:
I often tweak and update pages in Confluence. I also often forget to click the 'Minor Change' toggle before saving. It would be a great improvement to switch the 'Minor Change' from a toggle to a button. So at the bottom of the edit page, a user would see something like "Update", "Update and Notify", "Preview" and "Cancel". That way it would be one-click to make minor changes.

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 25 Oct 2010|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi All,
In the last couple of months we actually attempted this solution for the new Confluence editor (4.0). This method failed most of the user tests. Users were confused as to what to press, often asking "where do I save?". 

We discussed the rational behind this change - why do we want this change? The conclusion was that we want to reduce unnecessary notifications, or even more, improve the notifications in Confluence so that you don't get "notification storms". The issue CONF-14485 relates to this, and [so does the discussion here|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DISC/Email+Notification+Storms+-+Alternatives].

It is with this that we have decided we won't be implementing this change. Ultimately, our efforts should go towards solving the real problem - reducing and providing relevant notifications. We do want to do something about this beyond 4.0.
{panel}
fields.summary: Switch "Minor Change" from toggle to button

fields.summary: 1.3.5 backup can't be restored to 2.0 at config time, but can be restored later.

fields.description:
At the moment, we do not trigger an optimise of the index anywhere. 

This is having serious search performance implications for larger instances (~8 seconds to search for recently updated content on 60K pages).
fields.summary: Lucene index not optimised

fields.description:
I wanted to change the number of items in the 'Recently Edited' list on a user's profile page to 50. The default is 10. So I went into Global Layout and changed the "max" parameter to 50, from 10:

                                    #set ($title = $helper.getText("recently.edited.content"))
                                    #bodytag (Component "template='pagelist-single.vm'")
                                        #param ("title" "Recently Edited")
                                        #param ("showModifier" "false")
                                        #param ("pages" "recentlyUpdatedContent")
                                        #param ("max" 50) <!-- changed. default is 10 -->
                                    #end

But instead of getting 50 items, I get 20. If I change "max" to 5, I get 5. So does this mean there is a hard-coded limit of 20 in the recently.edited.content? Or is there a maximum date range, so that only results within a certain time frame are returned? If so, is it possible (for me or Atlassian) to change those limits?

I'm not certain this is a bug, but changing the parameter and not getting 50 items back felt like a bug, so I thought I should report it.
fields.summary: 'Recently Edited' list maxes out at 20 items
Opening curly braces which are not part of macro declarations are expensive to render

fields.description: The fact that the XML-RPC and SOAP APIs are different for this method and the same for just about everything else is confusing. Fix.
fields.summary: Sync SOAP / XML-RPC API for addAttachment.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-4712].
  {panel}

The following comment was made by Björn Feustel on the Remote API Specification page:

"It would be great if the confluence xml-rpc service would support server introspection via system.listMethods so one could use tools like xml-rpc-api2txt to get the actual interface description."

We need to fix the problem of our remote api documentation getting out of sync with the source. Some form of automated querying of the remote interface that can generate some for of documentation would be ideal in supporting the accurate generation of the Remote API spec.

There may be come tool support to help in this.
fields.summary: Support automated querying of the remote API.

fields.description:
We need a policy regarding setting up with a delegation chain.

If we allow for people to incorporate existing users or groups into the setup - i.e. an ldap confluence-users or an ldap admin account - we need to add a particular set up step.
fields.summary: Formalize set up procedure r.e. existing users and existing groups in a delegation

fields.description:
Hi there,

I have upgraded from 1.4.4 to 2.0 (installed 2.0 in its own folder and change the confluence-home to point to the 1.4.4 one.) I had previously loaded the database with some test spaces and pages and many spaces contain 1000 very small pages (there's no hierarchy, all pages are children of the space Home page -- but every page has a small comment.) 
After logging in, when I'm trying to access one of these spaces, it takes about 2 minutes for the list of pages to be displayed. 1.4.4 was slow too in displaying such a list but not this slow.

Thanks,
 Marius
fields.summary: Rendering spaces containing 1000+ pages slow

fields.summary: 2.0rc2 cannot delete a space made with 2.0rc1
Better email integration in Confluence: email archive as mailing list

fields.description:
Better mail integration in Confluence is needed to be as powerfull as Jira. Jira allows to comment ticket by answering by mail.

In Confluence, I would like to be able to receive new pages and changes by mail, and be able to answer to the mail and see the answer in the comments of the page.

The mail page would be more usefull if it could be managed as a mailing
>list: People in the team, can receive the mails send to the space
>address and answer to it. It will make it a simple but much more usefull
>tool to handle mails.
fields.summary: Better email integration: allow to add comment by email

fields.description:
If the upgrade task fails to remove the ancestors table for some reason, then it will hang on to foreign key relationships with the content table, making it impossible to delete content.

We should issue a "delete from ANCESTORS" before we try to drop it, just in case the drop fails. Although why you'd be able to do one and not the other I'm not sure of, but there's been one support case in which the table wasn't dropped, and it doesn't hurt to be sure.
fields.summary: Ancestors table hangs on to foreign key relationships if it can't be deleted

Confluence right away has reported that process of restoration is completed, though processor has been still loaded.

fields.summary: Confluence claims that a restore has been completed even though the restore is still running in the background.

fields.description:
If a dynamictasklist is not located within the viewable area of a page (i.e.: you would normally scroll down the page to see it), then upon loading the page, the cursor will jump to the form field in the tasklist, causing the browser to scroll all the way down to the location of the tasklist.

If the tasklist is located at the bottom of a page, for example, then each page load would cause the bottom of the page to display first, and the user would have to scroll up to the top of the page.

It would be nice if the tasklist did not steal or cause the cursor to jump to it's location.
fields.summary: Dynamic Task List Steals Cursor, Causing Page Scroll

fields.description:
http://jroller.com/page/wakaleo?entry=jtidy_and_memory_leaks

This is obviously a bad thing, since we use JTidy to clean up our HTML before it's run through XSL-FO, which means each PDF export will leak memory.

We should set up a job to run a few dozen/hundred exports, then run YourKit over the problem.
fields.summary: Possible memory leak in JTidy

In general testing on Windows I.E. 6 might need another run through.

This would be a useful extension to the blog post API.

fields.description:
Tying to convert a Word document to wiki markup by pasting the Word doc into the Rich Text Editor and then clicking Wiki Markup results in a NullPointer exception. Also clicking Save will cause a  NullPointer exception.

This issue is specific to MSWord and IE6. It works fine for any other combination eg. MSWord and Firefox or OpenOffice and IE6.
fields.summary: NullPointerException when saving a page with content pasted from MS Word

fields.description:
The daily notification e-mail displays the wrong date when a page was updated. 

The displayed date is actually the date of the previews update and not of the most recent update as one would expect. 

For example:

The email contained following header:
Remote API Specification  has been edited by Mister X  (Nov 17, 2005)

But the page history under the Info Tab tells us that the pages was updated on the 20th and not on the 17th:
Nov 20, 2005 03:44  	Mister X  	view changes
Nov 17, 2005 05:25 	Mister Z 	view changes
fields.summary: Daily notification email displays wrong date.

fields.description:
How to reproduce:

1) Click edit a page.
2) Select the WIKI tab.
3) make some changes
4) Select the WYSIWYG tab
5) Select the WIKI tab.

Your changes will have been replaced with the original version of the page.
fields.summary: Cycling between WIKI and WYSIWYG shows out of date data.

fields.description:
JIRA has a concept of the "universal access key" to submit a form; by default, this key is Alt + S. While Confluence does not have this idea, it would be really nice to have this to be possible for common functions like create, edit and commenting on a Confluence page.

I believe this is already true for Update (Save) but not for Comment (current it's Post). Maybe the term Post can be rephrased as "Submit" so we can use Alt + S there as well?
fields.summary: Use accesskey S (Alt + S) for Create, Edit Page and Submit Comment

fields.summary: Can't disable "Script executing and show flash macro" plugin.

fields.description:
In 1.4 I used the "Script executing and show flash macro" plugin to display SWF files, since I read in the new features that I can now do this without the plugin I went to update a page that uses the macro. I could view the page just fine but when I went to edit the page I couldn't do squat (wysiwyg or wiki or info).

I'm probably just going to uninstall the plugin, but anyway I'm not too sure this should be happening! Even for an old plugin :)

This is what I found in the logs:

fields.description:
To reproduce:

Create a page with the following Wiki Markup content:

|| Header || Header 2 ||

Switch back and forth between Rich Text and Wiki Markup tabs ... note that it works fine.

Now, in the Rich Text view, put the cursor at the end of the table, on the very next line (cursor blinking just below the table).  Click the insert-link icon and select a wiki page.  Click the Wiki Text tab and see that the content looks something like this:

|| Header || Header 2 ||[IT:My Page]

Click back to the Rich Text tab and see that the "IT:My Page" link has been sucked into the table, and now constitutes a third column.
fields.summary: Switching between Rich Text and Wiki Markup tabs sucks links that follow tables into the table itself

fields.description:
In 1.4.4, the {blog-posts:x} macro would display as many news items as indicated by 'x'.  What seems to be happening now is that only blog posts CREATED or UPDATED after upgrading to v2.0 are displayed.  Any news item created by 1.4.4 (or earlier) are not displayed by this macro, even when they should be.

You can check out this behaviour here: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/TEST2/test+page
fields.summary: {blog-posts:x} macro displays only news items that were created or edited after upgrading to v2.0

fields.description:
In previous versions, the viewrecentblogposts.action would display a calendar on the right side, allowing users to browse older blog posts.  This seems to have disappeared in version 2.0.

You can see the new (buggy?) behaviour here: http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewrecentblogposts.action?key=TEST2

Compare this to pre-2.0 releases, and it behaves differently.
fields.summary: viewrecentblogposts.action no longer displays calendar for navigation.

fields.description: In the search sub-tab of the popup selector when insert a link the spaces list (for limiting the search scope) brings only the 'All Spaces' option and all the other spaces have empty string descriptions. I'm attaching the source HTML script of the page, where you can see that all the spaces options are there but have empty strings as displaynames.
fields.summary: Space list drop down listbox in Link selector has empty string options

fields.description:
Hello,

for some tests (aim: converting our thousand Docbook XML docs to Confluence) we´re creating a space, watching the conversion results and deleting the space again. This process will be repeated the our whole conversion mechanism works fine.

When removing the space and re-creating it again (same space key),  we cannot upload the documents with the same article name again. We´re using a Python script to do so but it reports that the page already exists while no pages can be found in the Confluence space. This is the error message:
---
xmlrpclib.Fault: <Fault 0: 'java.lang.Exception: com.atlassian.confluence.rpc.RemoteException: The page you are trying to create already exists.'>
---

After stopping the script by CRTL-C, we can find the pages that produced the error linked under "Orphaned Pages" - assigned to anonymous without any time information (only after running the script).

We believe that the articles are kept in the database (MySQL) in spite of deleting the space. So, we need some assist to get rid of them again. Attached you can find the Python script we´re using.

Thanks for your help.

Best regards,
Heiko Burghardt
fields.summary: Articles remain in database after removing space

fields.description:
To reproduce:

1) Edit a page
2) Select a new space from the spaces drop-down
3) Select a parent page from the space you've selected (The parent page must have a unique name)
4) Save

Expected result: Page will be moved to the new space, and given the new parent
Actual result: Save fails with "page not found" error.

fields.description:
Replication steps:

1. Type text in WYSIWYG mode like "Some text."
2. Bold the entire phrase
3. Wiki notation is now '*Some text.*' - this is correct
4. Switch back to WYSIWYG mode
5. Highlight 'te' and select strike through - it should all be bolded with 'te' struck through
6. Wiki notation is now '*Some* te{*}xt.* - this is not correct

I thought we fixed the 'phrase formatting within text' by using 4 of each symbol. Did this not get done for 2.0? I can't find an issue for it.

fields.description:
Currently, the plugin class loader can't find classes which are in other uploaded plugins. It would make life so much easier if it could. Looking at the code, it seems like the solution would be to have the PluginClassLoader have a reference to the PluginManager and let it check through all the registered plugins if it can't find the class it's looking for. That said, there's currently no guarantee what order plugins are loaded in, so it might be necessary to add a <dependency pluginKey='my.plugin.key'> into the atlassian-plugin.xml descriptor, enabling the PluginManager to delay loading plugins until their dependencies have been loaded. Gets tricky if there are circular dependencies, but that's the developer's fault.

Any thoughts?

fields.description:
Confluence 2.x uses OSCache 2.1.1.

When deployed on weblogic 8.1, oscache blocks when a request is made to retrieve the main-css.action. This was not a problem with Confluence 1.4.4, which used OSCache 2.0.2-22Jan04.

We need to work out what the root cause of this problem is.

For anyone experiencing this problem, the short term workaround is to remove the use of the oscache, by removing the following entry from the WEB-INF/web.xml file:

<filter>
        <filter-name>CacheFilter</filter-name>
        <filter-class>com.opensymphony.oscache.web.filter.CacheFilter</filter-class>
</filter>
fields.summary: Confluence 2.x hangs on weblogic.
